newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan's Hub Power jumps 2.75 percent.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan's Hub Power jumps 2.75 percent.

text.p: Pakistan's Hub Power Co Ltd jumped 0.85 rupees, or 2.75 percent, to 31.65 on Tuesday after the State (central) Bank of Pakistan devalued the rupee by 7.86 percent against the dollar, dealers said.
The stock emerged as volume leader with turnover of over 3.8 million shares by midsession.

"Hub Power rose as there is a big difference in its local price and GDR (Global Depositary Receipt) rate," dealer Manochar Jamal said. "Hub Power's GDR is higher than its local price so people are adjusting the price in line with the devaluation."
